column5: Well, a couple buds and myself headed out to the lake today. The dock talk at the launch was that the fish were at 200ft. We ran out there and set up, still headed deeper. 7 miles and counting.  First fish happened pretty quick, a rainbow for rich.    Then this guy hit on my turn....    Frank was up next, but he didn't care much for a photo....he just wanted that fish on ice, and the line set back up  ;D I took one anyways....another bow.    We were marking lots of bait. We basically did a figure 8 between two big schools of bait the whole time we were out. We went from 200-250ft in and out.    A little brownie......my buddy got one about 14lbs on friday around the same area.    The lake was flat calm, and hotter than hell!!!    Nice sunset though....        We pulled lines at 8pm and headed in with some meat, and smiles on our faces. 4 bows, one chinook and the brown. Kept a bow each for dinner. We missed a couple more, and lost 2 fish too. All came off the riggers on a clown coloured NK down 35-50ft over 200-250. We had one more hit on the small diver out 200, but it didn't stick.  Nice way to cool off once the sun gets going down on these hot days ;D  S.
Nice fish!  Cant wait to get out myself.
Great report sinker.  You guys did well.  Its nice when the water is like glass eh.  Smoooth sailing!!!  Joey
Nice job Sinker ! What was the hot bait out there?
Real nice report Stinker... er... uh Sinker!!!  Some good looking fish you got there... you fracking meat hunter you!  I smirk at your description of hot weather!
Read it again Mike.....its all in there  This was a total meat hunt GCD........a successful one at that even  S.
Nothing wrong with that at all Bubba!!!... that's why God make the little fishies eh!  ... but ingesting all that mercury... do you find that you're taller on hot days and shorter on cold days???
I think he stands 6'3 in the winter..... Good shooting there Sinker.
Beauty report and pics Sinker Congrats Leechman
Nice going there Sinker. I have first hand reports that the cod have been hitting hard down home. Just add salt.LOL
Great pictures, especially the Chinook.  Thanks for the report Sinker.
